questions.question: I ................................ there for two hours and then I went home.
questions.description: The simple past is the most normal tense for talking about finished events.

questions.question: She ..................................... six novels so far.
questions.description: We often use the present perfect to give news.

questions.question: He ....................................... from Las Vegas yesterday.
questions.description: The simple past is the most normal tense for talking about finished events.

questions.question: The hostess made sure that the guests .................................... enough to eat and drink.
questions.description: When the main verb is in the past tense, the verb in the subordinate clause too will be in the past tense.

questions.question: You will get the job if you ................................................ in the interview.
questions.description: In the first conditional we use a simple present tense in the if clause and will + first form of the verb in the main clause.

questions.question: The doctor concluded that the man ...................................... several hours ago.
questions.description: The past perfect is used for the earlier of the two past actions.

questions.question: We ............................................ to hear from him for more than two weeks now.
questions.description: The present perfect continuous is used to talk about an action or situation that started in the past and has continued up to the present.

questions.question: The show ....................................... by the time we reached the theatre.
